skill.name: attack-tree-construction
skill.description: Build comprehensive attack trees to visualize threat paths. Use when mapping attack scenarios, identifying defense gaps, or communicating security risks to stakeholders.
skill.summary: Build comprehensive attack trees to visualize threat paths. Use when mapping attack scenarios, ident...

security_audit.summary: The skill contains documentation and code templates only. No file access, network calls, or execution behaviors are present.

content.user_title: Build attack trees for security analysis
content.value_statement: Security scenarios feel complex and hard to map. This skill provides clear attack tree structures and analysis helpers to communicate risks and gaps.
actual_capabilities: Define attack tree nodes with OR, AND, and leaf types
Assign attack attributes such as difficulty, cost, and detection risk
Build trees with a fluent builder pattern
Export trees to JSON, Mermaid, and PlantUML formats
Analyze attack paths and prioritize mitigations
limitations: Provides templates and guidance, not a running tool
Does not ingest live system data or scan infrastructure
No built in integration with ticketing or threat intel feeds
Requires manual inputs for attack nodes and attributes

use_cases.title: Model system threats
use_cases.description: Create attack trees to evaluate design risks and plan defensive investments.

use_cases.title: Plan test paths
use_cases.description: Map likely attack paths to focus testing on the highest impact routes.

use_cases.title: Communicate stakeholder risk
use_cases.description: Summarize attacker goals and mitigations for non technical audiences.

prompt_templates.title: Basic tree outline
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a simple attack tree for unauthorized access to a web app. List root goal, two sub goals, and leaf attacks.

prompt_templates.title: Attribute enriched tree
prompt_templates.prompt: Build an attack tree for data exfiltration and assign difficulty, cost, detection risk, and time for each leaf.

prompt_templates.title: Mermaid export
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a Mermaid flowchart for an attack tree about account takeover with OR and AND nodes.

prompt_templates.title: Mitigation prioritization
prompt_templates.prompt: Given an attack tree, identify critical nodes and prioritize mitigations by coverage impact.

output_examples.input: Create an attack tree for account takeover and highlight the easiest path.
output: Root goal: Take over user account
Easiest path: Steal credentials via phishing
Top mitigations: Email filtering, security awareness training, MFA

best_practices: Start with a clear attacker goal and scope
Include realistic attributes for each leaf attack
Review trees with domain experts and update often
anti_patterns: Building trees without assigning attack attributes
Ignoring insider and social engineering paths
Treating the tree as static once created

faq.question: Which platforms are supported?
faq.answer: The skill is text based and works in Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides templates and analysis logic but does not run scans or collect real data.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my tools?
faq.answer: It can export JSON, Mermaid, or PlantUML for use in other tools.

faq.question: Does it access my data?
faq.answer: No. The content has no file or network access behaviors.

faq.question: What if the tree looks incomplete?
faq.answer: Add more sub goals and validate with subject matter experts.

faq.question: How is this different from a threat model?
faq.answer: It focuses on attacker goal paths, while threat models cover broader assets and controls.
